page.title: 07Low Applegath
page.content: Mr and Mrs Barker own Low Applegarth. They own the orchard and the yard at the back of the farmhouse. The rest of the land belongs to farmer Mr Atkinson of East Applegarth. Mr Barker teaches in the local comprehensive school but enjoys the country. The land is very hilly. They sometimes have a few sheep for pleasure. The most they ever had was five. When they have sheep Mrs Barker usually weaves the wool. The lambing season is in the spring. They have one pony which is kept in in winter and out in summer. It is riden by the children. The house is rather old, it is made out of the local stone, which is limestone and sandstone.
